def.dt: :the sixth tone of a C-major scale
:a graphic device for reproducing the letter a
:one designated a especially as the first in order or class
:a grade rating a student's work as superior in quality
:one graded or rated with an A
:the one of the four ABO blood groups characterized by the presence of antigens designated by the letter A and by the presence of antibodies against the antigens present in the B blood group

entry.et: Middle English, from Old English ān one one

dt.un: used as a function word before singular nouns when the referent is unspecified a man overboard and before number collectives and some numbers a dozen

def.dt: :the same birds of a feather swords all of a length

dt.un: used as a function word before a singular noun followed by a restrictive modifier a man who was here yesterday

def.dt: :any a man who is sick can't work

dt.un: used as a function word before a mass noun to denote a particular type or instance a bronze made in ancient times
used as a function word before a proper noun representing an example or type the attractions of a Boston or a Cleveland
used as a function word before a proper noun to indicate limited knowledge about the referent a Mr. Smith called to inquire about the job
used as a function word before a proper noun to distinguish the condition of the referent from a usual, former, or hypothetical condition a triumphant Ms. Jones greeted her supporters
used as a function word with nouns to form adverbial phrases of quantity, amount, or degree felt a bit tired

entry.pt: In speech and writing a is used before a consonant sound a door a human. Before a vowel sound an is usual an icicle an honor but especially in speech a is used occasionally, more often in some dialects than in others a apple a hour a obligation. Before a consonant sound represented by a vowel letter a is usual a one a union but an also occurs though less frequently now than formerly an unique such an one. Before unstressed or weakly stressed syllables with initial h both a and an are used in writing a historic an historic. In the King James Version of the Old Testament and occasionally in writing and speech an is used before h in a stressed syllable an huntress an hundred children are an heritage of the Lord Psalms 127:3(Authorized Version).

entry.et: Middle English, from Old English a-, an, on

def.dt: :in, to, or for each twice a week
:have I might a had husbands afore now John Bunyan
:of often attached to the preceding word kinda lotta

entry.et: Italian a cappella in chapel style
New Latin, literally, from the stronger (argument)

def.dt: :with greater reason or more convincing force used in drawing a conclusion that is inferred to be even more certain than another the man of prejudice is, a fortiori, a man of limited mental vision
